com.esri.mo2.cs.geom
Class Cogo

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Cogo
public final class Cogo
extends Object

Provides frequently used CoOrdinate GeOmetry (COGO) methods and variables.

Returns:

clockwiseAngle

public static final double clockwiseAngle(Point from,
                                          Point center,
                                          Point to)
Returns an included angle in radians for the given three points. The first point represents the start point of a circular arc. The second point represents the center or radial/radius point of the circular arc, and the third point represents the ending point of the arc. The returned angle is in the range [0, 2*PI)

Parameters:
from - the starting point of the circular arc
center - the center point of the circular arc
to - the ending point of the circular arc
Returns:
the converted angle in radians

                                 double dy)
Returns an angle in the range [0.0, 2*PI) for the given change in x and y.

Parameters:
dx - the change in the x-direction
dy - the change in the y-direction
Returns:
the computed angle in radians

angle

public static final double angle(Point from,
                                 Point to)
Returns an angle in the range [0.0, 2*PI) for the vector specified by the two points.

Parameters:
from - the start point
to - the end point
Returns:
the computed angle in radians

azimuth

public static final double azimuth(Point from,
                                   Point to)
Returns an azimuth in the range [0.0, 2*PI) for the vector specified by the two points. An azimuth is "swung" clockwise with 0.0 at twelve o'clock.

Parameters:
from - the start point
to - the end point
Returns:
the computed azimuth in radians

azimuth

public static final double azimuth(double dx,
                                   double dy)
Returns an azimuth in the range [0.0, 2*PI) for the given change in x and change in y. An azimuth is "swung" clockwise with 0.0 at twelve o'clock.

Parameters:
dx - the change in the x-direction
dy - the change in the y-direction
Returns:
the computed azimuth in radians

rightOf

public static final double rightOf(Point start,
                                   Point end,
                                   Point off)
Determines whether a point is right of, left of, or on a line specified by the two points.

Parameters:
start - the start point of a line
end - the end point of a line
off - the point
Returns:
the number which indicates if the point is to the left (< 0.0), right(> 0.0), or on the line (0.0).

arcLine

public static final int arcLine(Point radpt,
                                double rad,
                                Point ptLine,
                                UnitVector2D vline,
                                double offLine,
                                Point[] ptInt)
Calculates the intersection(s) between a circle (infinite circular arc) and an infinite line. The infinite line can be specified by using an an offset from another line.

Parameters:
radpt - the radius point of a circle (circular arc)
rad - the radius of the circle
ptLine - a point on the line
vline - the unit vector specifying the direction of the line in question: right , left , or on the line.
offLine - the offset (+ is right, - is left) from the line creating a parallel line
ptInt - the intersection points which is an allocated array of 2 points
Returns:
the number of intersects will be, 1 if the line is tangent to the arc, 2 if the line is secant to the arc, and 0 if no intersects exist.

lineLine

public static final int lineLine(Point pt1,
                                 Point pt11,
                                 Point pt2,
                                 Point pt21,
                                 Point ptInt)
Calculates the intersection between two infinite lines specified by points.

Parameters:
pt1 - a point on the first line
pt11 - another point on the first line
pt2 - a point on the second line.
pt21 - another point on the second line.
ptInt - the intersection point (allocated before calling routine)
Returns:
the number of intersects will be 1 if an intersect occurs, otherwise 0.

arcArc

public static final int arcArc(Point radpt1,
                               double r1,
                               Point radpt2,
                               double r2,
                               Point[] ptInt)
Calculates the intersection(s) between the given circles (infinite circular arc).

Parameters:
radpt1 - the radius point of the first circle (circular arc)
r1 - the radius of the first circle
radpt2 - the radius point of the second circle (circular arc)
r2 - the radius of the second circle
ptInt - the intersection points which is an allocated array of 2 points
Returns:
the number of intersects will be, 1 if the circles are tangent, 2 if the circles are secant, and 0 if no intersects exist.

locatePoint

public static final void locatePoint(Point pt,
                                     UnitVector2D v1,
                                     double distance,
                                     double offset,
                                     Point ptLoc)
Traverses from a point at the specified distance, direction, and offset to locate a new point.

Parameters:
pt - the start point
v1 - the direction specified by a unit vector.
distance - the distance to travel in the direction v1.
offset - the offset distance to travel (+ is right, - is left)
ptLoc - the located new point(pre-allocated)

locateOffsetPoint

public static final void locateOffsetPoint(Point pt,
                                           UnitVector2D v1,
                                           double offset,
                                           Point ptLoc)
Traverses from a point at the specified offset distance (and direction) to locate a new point.

Parameters:
pt - the start point
v1 - the direction specified by a unit vector.
offset - the offset distance to travel (+ is right, - is left)
ptLoc - the located new point(pre-allocated)

station

public static final double station(Point start,
                                   Point end,
                                   Point off)
Computes the distance along an infinite line or station, to a specified point.

Parameters:
start - the start point of a line
end - the end point of a line (specifies the direction since this line is infinite)
off - the point to measure the distance
Returns:
the distance along the line to the offset point (positive/negative).

station

public static final double station(Point start,
                                   UnitVector2D vline,
                                   Point off)
Computes the distance along an infinite line or station, to a specified point.

Parameters:
start - the start point of a line
vline - the direction of the line (as a unit vector)
off - the point to measure the distance
Returns:
the distance along the line to the offset point (positive/negative).

offset

public static final double offset(Point start,
                                  UnitVector2D vline,
                                  Point off)
Computes the offset distance from an infinite line to a specified point.

Parameters:
start - the start point of a line
vline - the direction of the line (as a unit vector)
off - the point to measure the perpendicular distance to (offset distance).
Returns:
the offset distance from the line to the offset point. The distance will be negative for left offsets and positive for right offsets.

equal

public static final boolean equal(Point pt1,
                                  Point pt2)
Determines if the given points lie at the same location.

Parameters:
pt1 - the first point
pt2 - the second point
Returns:
True if points are at the same location, else False.

equal

public static final boolean equal(double pt1x,
                                  double pt1y,
                                  double pt2x,
                                  double pt2y)
Determines if the two points lie at the same location.

Parameters:
pt1x - the first point x coordinate
pt1y - the first point y coordinate
pt2x - the second point x coordinate
pt2y - the second point y coordinate
Returns:
True if points are at the same location, else False.

signum

public static final double signum(double number)
A mathematical signum function that returns,
  • -1.0 for a number < 0,
  • 1.0 for a number > 0,
  • 0.0 for a number = 0.

    Parameters:
    number - the number
    Returns:
    returns -1.0, 0.0, or 1.0.
